concept.title: Personal Meetings
concept.shortdesc: The My Meeting tab lists all meetings that belong to you.

conbody.p:
When creating or editing these meetings the following attributes can be set:
Password protected - You can decide if you want the meeting to be password protected. Participants will need to know the password before they can join.
Moderated - When you make a meeting moderated, only you or other moderators that you designate can start the meeting. A moderator can also control other aspects of the meeting such as who can present, muting participant audio, etc.
Allow Guests - You can decide if non-authenticated or guest users can join your meeting.
Conference Dial-in - If your organization has provisioned for telephony, you can configure you meetings to have dial-in support. Icons on each entry in the My Meetings list indicate which of these attributes is set.
Tap the + icon at the top of the screen to create a new personal meeting or swipe right to edit the meeting attributes.
